forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 53. West southwest wind around 12 mph.

forecast.name: Juneteenth
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West wind 9 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph.

weather_report:
As the night softly drapes Downtown San Francisco in its quiet embrace, the clear skies allow the stars to twinkle gently, hinting at a tranquil overnight low around 53 degrees. A light westerly breeze whispers through the air, a promise of the vibrant daylight to come. As dawn breaks on Juneteenth, expect the sun to rise boldly, illuminating the city in a golden glow. The day is set to be a sun-kissed affair with highs nearing 62, though the ever-present coolness of the bay may cause temperatures to dip slightly by afternoon.

The absence of fog now offers a breathtaking view, the marine layer retreating to make way for clarity from Sutro Tower. While the west wind picks up, gusting up to 31 mph, it brings with it a refreshing vitality that makes the air feel crisp and invigorating. Dress in layers, perhaps a light shirt paired with a comfortable jacket—this way, you can adapt to the ebbs and flows of the day. 

For those wandering the city today, consider a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero, where the lively sights and sounds of the bay will beckon. A visit to one of the local cafes for freshly brewed coffee, enjoyed outside while watching the world wake up, would be a most pleasant start. The openness of the day permits exploration—perhaps a visit to the bustling market or a quiet moment in one of the city's serene parks, absorbing the spirit of the occasion.
